ch

ts

th

ch

hart burning w

ch

o
of
his allayance & acquaintance w
t
e Germanes is nothing
needfull for this cuntry. The states I doe find could be
willing enough to give him his pasport but they owe him
at
e least for
e arrierages of his service, 60 thow-
sand pound sterling: for recovering whereof he wilbe

cuntry. It is not doubted very much but he meant to goe se
& visit

him for

e
menti

haps to treat w

The Cardinall cometh slowly remaining yet in
Lorraine,
or
as some say at
Luxemborgh
w
t
6000 foote, & 1200 horse: &
till his coming we imagine there will be nothing by the
attempted against us: & for us we are not readye to doe
any thing of moment.
And thus I take my humble leave
